title: Watch Meghan Markle's Inspiring International Day of the Girl Video, Featuring Footage of Her at 11
text:
From ELLE

Meghan Markle took a poignant trip down memory lane in honor of International Day of the Girl. She showcased her history of advocating for women's rights in a video montage posted on the Sussex Royal Instagram this Friday.

The 45-second video includes clips from the Duke and Duchess of Sussex's recent trip to South Africa, as well as throwback footage from two major moments in Meghan's pre-royal life. One is a 2015 speech the duchess gave as a representative for the UN where she declares, "It is said that girls with big dreams become women with vision."

That very sentiment is felt in the next clip of an 11-year-old Markle speaking to Inside Edition about writing to Procter & Gamble about a sexist commercial. A young Meghan says, "If you see something that you don’t like or are offended by on television or any other place, write letters and send them to the right people, and you can really make a difference for not just yourself but lots of other people." (She successfully campaigned for the company to change the ad.)

Meghan narrates the video with a simple and empowering statement about female equality:

Today is International Day of the Girl. Every girl has potential. She has promise. She has the right to learn, the right to be heard, the right to play and to discover, the right to be exactly who she is.

So to each one of you, keep asking questions, keep pushing forward, keep shining brightly. Know your worth and know that we are behind you every step of the way.
